variants.Description in input context: Mutations of the mitochondrial PTEN (phosphatase and tensin homologue)-induced kinase1 (PINK1) are important causes of recessive Parkinson disease (PD).

mutation_impact: Impact on Complex I activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain, resulting in mitochondrial depolarization and increased sensitivity to apoptotic stress

additional_details.Mechanism: Decreased Complex I activity leading to mitochondrial dysfunction
additional_details.clinical_relevance: Human wild type PINK1 can rescue Complex 1 deficiency
